"Border Security" is buzzword and a scheme to funnel money to corporations, organized crime and other oligarchic outlets.
The feds already have the tools to investigate, track, and crack down on businesses violating labor and migration laws. But they don't. I wonder why that is...
Likewise, the "sovereignty" crowd never seems interested in unionizing illegals - which would remove them as an easy source of revenue - or improving labor rights and living conditions abroad - which would stop them from coming entirely.

The only people that suffer are the desperate poor, and tax-paying workers.

> [lumenwood](#comment_6_1KZKeEyDG87Yz9dVn9q4GVaPp78YWtRxxn): What was the Holodomor again?
You're just deflecting, which is a typical alt-right tactic.
But I'll bite: The Holodomor was famine affecting predominantly the eastern Ukraine and the Caucasus (and not just Ukraine as often stated). One following severe droughts, and exacerbated by bureaucratic incompetence, cruelty and misguided class warfare.
None of that proves what you just said however, nor disprove what I posted.

Adding to that: Periodic famines have plagued Russia since before (and during) Tsarist times. And were only ended during Soviet times. (Who cares about all the ethnic Russians, Ukrainians, and others who died during Imperial times, right?) The total death toll - excluding demographic deficits - has been estimated as between ~2 and 4 million.
Contrast that with the death-toll in Nazi occupied Europe, which - even when excluding jews - surpasses over 20 million.

That's real White Genocide.

> [lumenwood](#comment_7_1KZKeEyDG87Yz9dVn9q4GVaPp78YWtRxxn): A plague is one thing, but the insurrection and takeover of malicious (((Communists))) and deliberate disarmament / mass starvation of Kulaks (farmers) is another story. [...]
And here it is: Typical alt-right hypocrisy.
The starvation of millions is an atrocity. But the intentional slaughter of dozens of millions, the systematic annihilation of the Polish nation and it's cultural heritage (See the razing of Warsaw), the strategic bombing of non-military targets (Coventry, Rotterdam, etc.), the genocidal siege of Leningrad (~600,000-1 million deaths), the planned destruction of Paris, the occupation of Czechoslovakia,  the anti-partisan actions in the Balkans and Greece, Generalplan ost, the Dutch famine of 1944, slave labor of native White Europeans? Just a statistic.

> [lumenwood](#comment_9_1KZKeEyDG87Yz9dVn9q4GVaPp78YWtRxxn): Self defense is not a rampage, Stalin had already mobilized 40,000 tank ahead of time to attempt a mass blitzkrieg (ironic lmao) of Europe. The entirety of Europe would've become a Bolshevik hellhole the likes you couldn't even possible imagine. It is well documented that Hitler attempted to contact Churchill numerous times, both BEFORE and DURING the war, to negotiate for peace. He stated that the Brits and the French were both a noble people and to go to war with them would be a disaster. But what did Churchill say?? "LOL no, fuck off faggot, I like being a slave to International Rootless Cosmopolitan Desert Tribesmen!!! Why don't you? Are you an anti-Semite or something? :^)"
And yet more denials, lies and deflections.
The Poles weren't Bolsheviks; in fact they fought them (and won) from 1919-1921. 
The Czechs weren't Bolsheviks.
The Danes and Norwegians weren't.
Nor the Dutch, the Belgians, the Greeks, the Serbs, the French or even - after 1943 - the Italians.

The war against Poland was a war of aggression. In a direct violation of the Polish-German non-aggression pact (Which Hitler unilaterally rescinded), and the Munich agreement. 
Contrary to Nazi propaganda, the invasion of Poland was planned way before the Gleiwitz incident - as reported by Clare Hollingworth, with tanks and camps being positioned days before the war.
Churchil - for all his flaws - can't be blamed for not taking up Hitler at his word, considering agreements with the Nazis were already proven not to be worth the paper they were written on.
